result.markdown: --- title: "What is civil war?" menu: assignment: parent: Assignments weight: 2 --- ## Instructions - For the data, right-click, "save/download file as..." - Open the data - Complete all of the tasks associated with that data and keep track of your answers / images - **Once you are done**, go on Canvas and answer the questions related to the assignment - the Canvas assignment is **timed**; if you open it prior to completing the tasks you will run out of time Skills used: - Sorting data - Counting categories - Cross-tabs - Creating variables [My awkward Google Sheets video tutorials are here](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/rsj9qm67se619pm/AAD1wPt84O8yaIfSPcwN9edua?dl=0) ::: {.callout-warning} You must complete all of the tasks here BEFORE opening the Canvas quiz; otherwise, you will run out of time! ::: ## Data You're going to work with the data from the Kalyvas and Balcells article we read. The dataset contains information on major civil wars around the world for a select time period. Every row here is a civil conflict. - The data: [Kalyvas and Balcells](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/rpqb5sryxp5wqeivjqui2/balcells-kalyvas.csv?rlkey=jysyuzvj4xvhv6yzpn1jiepdq&dl=1) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} -------------------------------------------------------------- Variable Description ------------------------------ ------------------------------- countryname Country where civil war takes place year/month_start Year/month war began year/month_end Year/month war ended (if at all) conflict_name Name of conflict region World region gdp_capita GDP per capita (logged) rough_terrain Percent of country covered in rough terrain military_personnel_percapita Military personnel, in thousands marxist Is rebellion Marxist? technologyrebellion What kind of civil war is it? ethnicwar Is this an ethnic civil war? -------------------------------------------------------------- ::: ## Questions Using the dataset, answer the following questions: 1. Choose a civil war of each **type** in the dataset and look it up on Wikipedia. Provide a non-technical, 2 sentence description of each war. (total = 3 wars, 2 sentences each). (2 points) 2. Sort the data. Which COUNTRY had the largest army per capita involved in a civil war? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 3. Count the number of civil wars by region. Which REGION has the SECOND highest number of recorded civil wars? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 4. Create a cross-tab of `warfare technology` and `ethnic` conflict. How many civil wars are both "conventional" and NOT ethnically motivated? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 5. Create a variable that tells you how long each civil war has lasted, using only the years column (year ended - year started. Note: don't worry about civil wars that don't have a start or end date, you can ignore this issue). In which country did the *THIRD* longest lasting civil war take place? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 6. Filter this analysis down so you're only looking at sub-Saharan Africa. What is the longest CONFLICT in this region? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 7. We we will frequently talk about civil wars "starting" and "ending" in this class, but figuring out exactly *when* this happens is tricky. If you were to design a rule for deciding when a civil war has **begun**, what would that rule be? What would you have to observe, exactly, to say that a war has broken out? (3 points) A) describe your rule, make it as specific as possible. For example: "*We can say that a civil war has begun when X, Y, and Z happens...*" B) Identify some "edge cases" that will cause trouble for that rule. 4-5 sentences.
